A.content: Imagine you are A, negotiating with another player B. You need to share 1 book, 1 hat, and 3 balls. For each book you receive, you get 0 points. For each hat you receive, you get 4 points. For each ball you receive, you get 2 points. For each book player B receives, they get 4 points. For each hat player B receives, they get 6 points. For each ball player B receives, they get 0 points. You can communicate with the other player for 6 rounds to reach an agreement. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose how many of each item you will take. The sum of items taken by both players cannot exceed the available inventory. Your goal is to maximize your total points. Remember, if you choose more items than available, you will receive 0 points.

B.content: Imagine you are B, negotiating with another player A. You need to share 1 book, 1 hat, and 3 balls. For each book you receive, you get 4 points. For each hat you receive, you get 6 points. For each ball you receive, you get 0 points. For each book player A receives, they get 0 points. For each hat player A receives, they get 4 points. For each ball player A receives, they get 2 points. You can communicate with the other player for 6 rounds to reach an agreement. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose how many of each item you will take. The sum of items taken by both players cannot exceed the available inventory. Your goal is to maximize your total points. Remember, if you choose more items than available, you will receive 0 points.

moderator.content: You are the moderator. You are moderating a conversation between two players A and B. Your goal is to make sure that the players cooperate and maximise points. You also want to promote fairness, that is equitable distribution of points. For each book player A receives, they get 0 points. For each hat player A receives, they get 4 points. For each ball player A receives, they get 2 points. For each book player B receives, they get 4 points. For each hat player B receives, they get 6 points. For each ball player B receives, they get 0 points. You MUST ensure that the agents choose a valid allocation of 1 book, 1 hat, and 3 balls.

A.content: You are player A. You will start a conversation negotiating with player B about your proposed allocation. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

B.content: You are player B. You will start a conversation negotiating with player A about your proposed allocation. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

moderator.content: You are the conversation moderator. Help the two players A and B negotiate to reach a conclusion. ASSERT that the sum of items taken by both players cannot exceed the available inventory. If they attempt to take more than what is available, they will both receive 0 points. Your response should be at most 2 lines.

A.content: You are player A. The sum of items taken by both players cannot exceed the available inventory of 1 book, 1 hat, and 3 balls.  If you and the other player try to select more items than available, you will both get 0 points. Before you decide how many of each item to take, please think about what the other player might choose. To ensure a valid outcome, consider choosing fewer items than you might want, as this will help avoid exceeding the available inventory. If you take x of book, y of hat, and z of ball, and the other agent takes a of book, b of hat, and c of ball, output a sequence of six natural numbers x y z a b c and NOTHING else.

B.content: You are player B. The sum of items taken by both players cannot exceed the available inventory of 1 book, 1 hat, and 3 balls.  If you and the other player try to select more items than available, you will both get 0 points. Before you decide how many of each item to take, please think about what the other player might choose. To ensure a valid outcome, consider choosing fewer items than you might want, as this will help avoid exceeding the available inventory. If you take x of book, y of hat, and z of ball, and the other agent takes a of book, b of hat, and c of ball, output a sequence of six natural numbers x y z a b c and NOTHING else.
